title: The US Navy, NATO, and NASA are using a shady Chinese company’s encryption chips
description: US government warns encryption chipmaker Hualan has suspicious ties to China’s military.

title: Weirdly, a NASA official says fixed-price contracts do the agency “no good”
description: "What really makes me worried is that I think it shows where the heart of the agency is."

title: Valve gives Steam its biggest update and redesign in years
description: It's a night-and-day difference for macOS and Linux users.

title: FCC chair to investigate exactly how much everyone hates data caps
description: ISPs clearly have technical ability to offer unlimited data, chair's office says.

title: Deadly fungal meningitis cases nearly double as CDC rushes to find exposed
description: The source and fungus are both elusive; officials are aggressively treating exposed.

title: Ultra low-cost smartphone attachment measures blood pressure at home
description: Clever use of physics uses pressure on the skin and optics to track blood flow.

title: Windows 11 beta fixes major taskbar gripe, removes old File Explorer settings
description: New build also (sort of) removes OS-level Microsoft Teams integration.

title: Twitter restricted Democrat’s pro-abortion ad—but platform may backpedal
description: Twitter ad policy restricting abortion advocacy may soon change, employee says.

title: Google is “winding down” Google Domains by selling it to Squarespace
description: Transition is automatic, but Squarespace honoring renewal fees for only 1 year.

title: Millions of Americans’ personal DMV data exposed in massive MOVEit hack
description: Over 6.5 million residents of two states affected, impact may potentially widen.

title: Retro MacOS desktop blanket trades pixels for thread, and it looks Mac-nificent
description: New knit screenshot throw celebrates the Mac's early years. We talk to its creator.

title: Dealmaster: Summer savings on laptops, smartphones, and smartwatches
description: With savings on laptops and smartphones, now is a great time to upgrade your gear.

title: Rocket Report: China addresses falling rocket debris, Vulcan launch slipping
description: FAA is "taking a finer pencil to the way operations are run and managed."
